introduction: The following text is adapted from The Adventures of Tom Sawyer by Mark Twain (1876). Tom, a young boy, has just completed a difficult task and is feeling proud of himself.
text: Tom sat down on the grass, feeling the satisfaction of a job well done. The sun shone brightly, and the distant hum of the village was a quiet accompaniment to the moment. He looked at the fence he had just whitewashed—his work. It was no small feat. The wooden planks were neat, the lines crisp, and there was a certain pride in how the work had turned out. He couldn’t help but smile, though he knew the task had originally seemed tedious and endless.
question: Which choice best describes the function of the underlined portion in the text as a whole?
A: It describes how Tom managed to finish the task despite finding it difficult at first.
B: It highlights the contrast between Tom’s initial reluctance and his current satisfaction with the task.
C: It suggests that Tom may not appreciate the work he has done as much as he lets on.
D: It emphasizes how much Tom values his work now that it is complete.
explanation: Choice B is the best answer because it captures Tom’s shift from the initial tediousness of the task to a feeling of pride in his completed work. The passage emphasizes Tom’s satisfaction, noting his smile and the neatness of the work.
